ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six spoke with food in their mouths. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not speak with food in my mouth,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.4_0: he should not speak with food in his mouth;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, speaks with food in his mouth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.9_0: The third training rule is finished.
